lines.text: Mr. McGonigle, I've got to have some money.
Yes, my lad, how much?
Two dollars.
If I had two dollars, I'd start a number two company.
For two cents I'd quit.

[to Marmaduke]
Pay him off!
[Marmaduke gives him a two cent stamp]

[after McGonigle takes a heavy fall]
Marky, are you hurt?

[sarcastically]
No, I had the presence of mind to fall on my head.

[referring to Cleopatra]
She's all dressed up like a well-kept grave.

[after Baby Albert has splashed soup over him]
I don't know whether to eat from the coat or the plate!

[after Baby Albert throws McGonigles watch into a bowl of molasses]
Oh, Albert! Look what you've done to Mr. McGonigle's watch! Oh...
[the watch is shown sinking]
Oh, I'm so sorry... Oh, Mr. McGonigle!
It's all right.
He has such an impulsive nature.
Yeah, just like my own. Don't apologize. It's all right. It's just a little child... it's just a little child.
Oh, he does the cutest things!
That he does!
You should see him when no one's around.
Oh, I'd like to catch him sometime when...
[Correcting himself]
Uh, SEE him sometime when no one's around.
Oh, Albert, why did you do that?

[Mumbling to himself]
Bet the minute hand won't be a bit of use after this!
Mr. McGonigle, I hope he hasn't hurt your watch.

[Sarcastically]
Oh, no, how could you hurt a watch by dipping it in molasses?
Oh, he's never done that before.
[She titters]
Well, I hope he doesn't do it again - not with this watch.

[In character in "The Drunkard," the play-within-a play]
It ain't a fit night out for man or beast!
When is Cleo gonna act in this show?
Oh, yes, yes, yes. She'll probably go on right after the epilogue.

[as the boarding house guest are eating]
The soup sounds good.
